Citations

Anderson, R. E., & Stevenson, H. C. (2019). RECASTing racial stress and trauma: Theorizing the healing potential of racial socialization in families. In American Psychologist (Vol. 74, Issue 1, pp. 63–75). American Psychological Association (APA). https://doi.org/10.1037/amp0000392

Chen, Kaiping and Lee, Nathan and Lee, Nathan and Marble, William, How Policymakers Evaluate Online versus Offline Constituent Messages (November 30, 2018). http://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.3251651

Clear, James, author. Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: an Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones. New York, New York:Avery, an imprint of Penguin Random House, 2018.

Terragotchi

Tend to your own pocket-sized Earth by learning and practicing sustainable behaviors and mindsets, supported by constructive strategies for navigating climate anxiety.

Overview

Terragotchi is a concept app researched, designed, and developed between January-May 2025 as my Capstone Project for the UX Design Masters Program at the Maryland Institute College of Art. The app combines resource wiki, habit tracking, mindfulness, and virtual-pet gamification to educate, encourage, and strengthen sustainable lifestyles while providing guidance on navigating climate anxiety.
